page.title: 10Changing Times Class 6
page.content: Staining started with about 75 houses and had open views into Blackpool. The Plough Inn is well over 200 years old. Staining School used to be where the chip shop now stands. It had a headteacher and two assistants. The Schoolboard visited once a month to check on the work being done. All the children wore clogs, the boys breeches and the girls, pinafores. They had no homework but had to work very hard at home both before and after school. Games of marbles and collections of cigarette cards were very popular. There was one shop but it sold no sweets so the children made their own from a mixture of cocoa powder and sugar. Sugar butties were a favourite snack. Jelly and custard was a special treat on Sundays. The annual trip to Lytham was the highlight of the year when they wore their Sunday Best.
